comment: Great professor. I knew almost nothing about programming before this class. It is a great introduction to the subject and I highly recommend this professor. The grading criteria is very straight forward: Does your program run like it is supposed to.

Took him for Programming Principles 1 as a hybrid course. There is a lot of homework but if you do it you will pretty much learn how to code, if you don't do it you won't pass. Tests are important but if you do the homework you will have the answers and he reviews for tests super well! Class is pretty open but there is a lot of homework, ask qs

This used to be the course number for Programming in C in a UNIX environment.  Not an easy class if u r not familiar with C or UNIX, but that's because of the material, not the instructor.  It is a manageable class if u doing the work.  While class is not mandatory, you do not attend at your own risk.
